meanings.definition: The act of turning around or changing direction.
meanings.sent1: The turnaround of the ship was slow but steady.
meanings.sent2: The bus made a quick turnaround at the next stop.
meanings.sent3: The penguin's turnaround on the ice was quite amusing to watch.
meanings.sent4: Her life took a dramatic turnaround after she moved to the city.
meanings.sent5: The sudden turnaround of events left everyone surprised.

meanings.definition: A quick change in behavior or attitude.
meanings.sent1: His turnaround from being grumpy to cheerful was unexpected.
meanings.sent2: The team's turnaround in performance impressed everyone.
meanings.sent3: The cat's turnaround from aloof to affectionate was quite amusing.
meanings.sent4: Her turnaround in opinion about the movie was surprising.
meanings.sent5: The sudden turnaround in weather caught us off guard.

meanings.definition: The time it takes to complete a task or process.
meanings.sent1: The project's turnaround was longer than expected.
meanings.sent2: The quick turnaround of orders is crucial for customer satisfaction.
meanings.sent3: The snail's turnaround in finishing the race was amusing.
meanings.sent4: The turnaround in processing time saved us a lot of effort.
meanings.sent5: The efficient turnaround of the assembly line increased productivity.
